info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 2:41PM EDT until May 13 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain threat had ended across the advised area, but not after localized 2 inches of rain had fallen between West Concord and Harrisburg. Rapid rises along Coddle Creek and select tributaries had occurred and Wolf Meadow Branch was overtopping Stough Road. Continue to remain wary of rising water levels in the Coddle Creek and Rocky River basins this afternoon.
- Some locations that may experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg and Charlotte Motor Speedway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
